page.title: 01KEMPSEY AREA - BACKGROUND.
page.content: In the first Domesday Survey in 1086,Kempsey had 24 hides of land and 2 ploughs. There were 15 farm servants and 27 farm servants of the lowest rank. The other residents were one priest, four serfs and two serving women; the total population was about {210.}There were 40 acres of meadow and a wood a mile long and half a mile wide, but no mention of fishponds or windmills. The census figure of 2,925 from 1981 has risen to{3000}with the opening of estates at Kings Hill and Plovers Rise. Compared to the survey in 1086, the amount of land actually designated as being part of Kempsey has increased and more machinery is used in agriculture. Today Kempsey is considered as one of England's largest villages.
